title: FC Viljandi (2011)
text:
FC Viljandi was an <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a>n <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club from the town of <a href="Viljandi">Viljandi</a>, that played in the Estonian <a href="Meistriliiga">Meistriliiga</a> in 2011 and 2012.
History.
The club was created in early 2011, after <a href="Viljandi%20JK%20Tulevik">Viljandi JK Tulevik</a> decided to rebuild the squad with local amateur players and dropped down two levels to play in <a href="Second%20League%20of%20Estonia">second league</a>. As that left a gap in <a href="Meistriliiga">Meistriliiga</a>, it was filled with a temporary club FC Viljandi, which was mostly composed by the same players that previously played for Tulevik.
The club was withdrawn from the championship after the 2012 season, when Tulevik won promotion to <a href="Esiliiga">Esiliiga</a>, the second highest division of Estonia.
